other_tests.findings: Psychotic mania characterized by elation, irritability, grandiosity, impulsive generosity, insomnia, hypersexuality, delusions of external control, excessive religiousness
other_tests.changes_over_time: Symptoms evolved to euphoria, impulsive generosity, increased libido, excessive religiousness, thought disorder, grandiose delusions, and delusions of external control.
A follow-up exam later showed a score of 30/30 indicating return to baseline cognitive function.

other_tests.findings: Initial dose of 150 mg twice daily; increased to 300 mg twice daily
other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment aimed to stabilize the patient post-mania; lithium was eventually discontinued after several months at the patient's request.
